sen.j: 京都駅（きょうとえき）は、京都府京都市下京区東塩小路町・南区 (京都市)にある、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）・東海旅客鉄道（JR東海）・近畿日本鉄道・京都市交通局の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Kyoto Station, located in Higashi-Shiokojicho, Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a railway station served by the lines of West Japan Railway Company (JR West), Central Japan Railway Company (JR Central), Kintetsu Corporation, and the Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau.

Kyoto Station, located in Higashi-Shiokojicho, Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a railway station served by the lines of West Japan Railway Company (JR West), Central Japan Railway Company (JR Central), Kintetsu Corporation and the Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau.

Kyoto Station, located in Higashi-Shiokojicho, Shimogyo Ward / Minami Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a railway station served by the lines of West Japan Railway Company (JR West), Central Japan Railway Company (JR Central), Kintetsu Corporation and the Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau.

sen.j: 日本有数の観光都市である京都市の中心を担う駅である。
sen.e: It plays a central role in Kyoto City, one of the foremost tourist cities in Japan.
It plays a central role in Kyoto City, one of the foremost tourist areas in Japan.
It plays a central role in Kyoto City, one of the foremost tourist areas in Japan.

sen.j: 当駅を営業区間に含む東海道新幹線の全列車が停車し、南東北から関東地方・中部地方・中国地方・四国・九州地方に渡る広範囲からの高速バス路線が多数発着することから、日本全国から訪れる客は多く1日平均の乗降人員が各社合計で63万人を超える。
sen.e: As all the trains of the Tokaido Shinkansen which pass in the section operated by the station make a stop, and a lot of express buses which are connected with various destinations ranging from the South Tohoku District to Kanto, Chubu, Chugoku-Shikoku, and Kyushu District, depart from and arrive at the station, a large number of people arrive from all over Japan, and total number of the users of the railway companies exceeds 630,000 a day on an average.

Because all the trains of the Tokaido Shinkansen that pass in the section operated by the station make stops--and since many express buses which are connected with various destinations ranging from the South Tohoku District to Kanto, Chubu, Chugoku-Shikoku, and Kyushu District, depart from and arrive at the station--large numbers of people arrive from all over Japan and the total number of the users of the railway companies exceeds 630,000 a day on the average.

Because all the trains of the Tokaido Shinkansen make stops at Kyoto Station--and since many express buses connected with various destinations ranging from the South Tohoku District to Kanto, Chubu, Chugoku, Shikoku, and Kyushu District, depart from and arrive at the station--large numbers of people arrive from all over Japan, and the average total number of users of the Kyoto Station exceeds 630,000 a day.
sen.cmt: 中国地方と四国地方を分けました。 Railway companiesのuserではなく、京都駅のuserと解釈して訳しました。

sen.j: 東海道本線（JR京都線・琵琶湖線）・湖西線用のプラットホーム形状と配置4面6線とプラットホーム形状と配置1面1線、構内西側に山陰本線（嵯峨野線）用の頭端式ホーム3面4線、南側に奈良線用の頭端式ホーム2面3線（8番のりばのみ大阪方面に延びている）、東海道新幹線用の島式ホーム2面4線を持つ。
sen.e: The station is equipped with 4 (ordinary) platforms with 6 tracks for the Tokaido Main Line (JR Kyoto Line/Biwako Line) and one (ordinary) platform with one track for the Kosei Line, 3 bay platforms with 4 tracks for the San'in Main Line (Sagano Line) in the west side of the yard, 2 bay platform with 3 tracks for the Nara Line in the south side (except platform No. 8, which extends toward the direction to Osaka), 2 island platform with 4 tracks for the Tokaido Shinkansen.

sen.e: The station is equipped with four (ordinary) platforms with six tracks for the Tokaido Main Line (JR Kyoto Line/Biwako Line) and one (ordinary) platform with one track for the Kosei Line, three bay platforms with four tracks for the San'in Main Line (Sagano Line) in the west side of the yard, two bay platforms with three tracks for the Nara Line in the south side (except platform No. 8, which extends toward the direction to Osaka), and two island platform with four tracks for the Tokaido Shinkansen.

sen.j: 北側の烏丸中央口に面しているホームは、全長558mで交通に関する日本一の一覧鉄道長いホームとして知られているが、0番のりば（旧1番線）のホーム自体の長さは323mである。
sen.e: Although the platform facing to the Karasuma Chuo-guchi (central entrance/exit) is 558m long and known as the longest railway platform in Japan in the transportation sector, the platform No.0 (former No1) itself is 323m long.
sen.cmt: 烏丸中央口→Karasuma Chuo-guchi (central entrance/exit)、文脈で出口・入口が変わるので、以降、～口という名称は、例外を除き（たとえば新幹線口）～口→～-kuchi/-guchi (entrance/exit）としました。
sen.e: Although the platform facing the Karasuma Chuo-guchi (central entrance/exit) is 558 m long and is known throughout the transportation sector as the longest railway platform in Japan, platform No. 0 (former No. 1) is 323 m long.

sen.j: この30番のりばは関西空港駅行の特急「はるか (列車)」専用で、運転開始当初は「はるかホーム」という名称が付けられていた。
sen.e: The platform No. 30 is exclusively used for Limited Express "Haruka" bound for Kansai Airport Station, and when the operation was started, it was called "Haruka (faraway) Platform".

sen.j: 1番のりばを0番のりばに改称したのは、配線上の番号とホーム番号を一致させるための措置で、現在の1番線は0番のりばと2番のりばの間にある東海道線上り通過線の番号になっている。
sen.e: The name of the former platform No. 1 was changed to platform No.0 in order to reorganize the platform numbers in concordance with the track numbers, and therefore, the present track No.1 situated in between the platform No.0 and No.2 corresponds to the Tokaido Line up track for nonstop trains.

The name of the former platform No. 1 was changed to platform No. 0 in order to reorganize the platform numbers in accordance with the track numbers, and therefore the present track No. 1 situated in between platforms No. 0 and No. 2 corresponds to the Tokaido Line up track for nonstop trains.

The name of the formerPlatform 1 was changed to Platform 0 in order to reorganize the platform numbers in accordance with the track numbers, and therefore the present Platform 1, which is situated between Platform 0 and 2, corresponds to the Tokaido Line inbound track for nonstop trains.

sen.j: これに関連して、東海道線の下り通過線は現在廃止されており、当駅を通過する吹田方面行きの貨物列車は7番のりばを通過する形になっている。
sen.e: In relation to this setup, the Tokaido Line down track for nonstop trains is currently disused, and the freight trains toward Suita Station pass through the platform No7.

In relation to this setup, the Tokaido Line outbound track for nonstop trains is currently not used; instead, the freight trains toward Suita Station pass through Platform 7.

sen.j: 西側にある山陰本線のりばは、以前は「山陰1-4番線」と呼ばれていたが、1994年12月にホーム番号の呼び名が整理され、「はるかホーム」を含めて30-34番のりばと呼ぶようになった。
sen.e: The platforms for the San'in Main Line constructed in the west side were called "San'in No. 1" to "4" before, but in December, 1994, the platform names were revised and since then these platforms have been called "platform No. 30" to "34" including so called "Haruka Platform".

The platforms for the San'in Main Line constructed on the west side were called "San'in No. 1" to "4" before, but in December 1994 the platform names were revised; subsequently, these platforms have been called "platform No. 30" to "34," including the so-called "Haruka Platform."

The platforms for the Sanin Main Line constructed on the west side were previously called 'Sanin Platform 1 to 4, but in December 1994 the platform names were revised; subsequently, these platforms were designated as Platform 30 to 34, including the so-called 'Haruka' Platform.

sen.j: 30番台にしたのは、山陰本線の「さん」にかけたものである。
sen.e: These platform were designated to have numbers, thirty something ("san-ju …" in Japanese.), in order to phonetically mach with the name of the line, the San'in Line, which begins with "san".
These platform were designated to have numbers incorporating "thirty" ("san-ju …" in Japanese.), in order to phonetically match the name of the line, the San'in Line, which begins with "san."
These platforms were designated to have numbers incorporating '30' (San-ju …in Japanese), in order to phonetically match the name of the line, the Sanin Line, which begins with 'san.'

sen.j: 34番のりばは、日本一大きい数字のホーム番号である。
sen.e: Platform No.34 has the biggest number for railway platform in Japan.
Platform No. 34 has the biggest number of any railway platform in Japan.

sen.j: 以前は現0番のりばが2番線、現2番のりばが4番線、現7番のりばが11番線と呼ばれていたが、運行管理システムの導入の際に線路呼称を変え、運転線路名とのりば名を一致させた。
sen.e: Previously, the present platforms No. 0, No.2 and No.7 were called No. 2, No.4, and No.11, respectively, but when the operation control system was introduced, their names were changed in order to conform the platform numbers to the respective track numbers.

sen.j: 4代目の新駅ビル建設に際して旧1番線をつぶし、現0番のりばのホーム拡幅に利用している。
sen.e: When the 4th generation new building was constructed, the former platform No.1 was demolished, and the existent platform No.0 was widened for the actual use.
When the new, fourth-generation building was constructed, the former platform No. 1 was demolished, and the existing platform No. 0 was widened for actual use.

sen.j: 0・30・31番のりばを1つのホームとして見た時の長さが558mであり、日本最大の長さである。
sen.e: If the platforms No. 0, 30, and 31 can be considered as one stretch of platform, it measures 558m long and is the longest platform in Japan.
If the platform nos. 0, 30 and 31 were considered as one stretch of platform, it would measure 558m long and would therefore be the longest in Japan.

sen.e: The elevator connecting the Shinkansen platforms and the ticket wicket for the Shinkansen is controlled by an attendant of the station.

sen.j: 在来線の出入口は、北側地上に「烏丸中央口」、北側地下1階に「地下中央口」、南北自由通路に通じる西側橋上駅舎上に「西口」、地下自由通路に通じる地下1階に「地下東口」、南東側地上に「八条東口」、山陰線ホームからアクセスできるビックカメラJR京都店二階に「西洞院口」がある。
sen.e: The entrances/exits of conventional lines are situated as follows: "Karasuma Chuo-guchi (Karasuma central entrance/exit)" for the north side on the ground, "Chika Chuo-guchi (underground central entrance/exit)" for the north side of the first floor in the basement, "Nishi-guchi (west entrance/exit)" for the rooftop of the Station Building built on the west bridge which connects the Nanboku Jiyu Tsuro (north-south free walkway), "Chika Higashi-guchi (underground east entrance/exit)" for the first floor in the basement which connects the Chika Jiyu Tsuro (underground free walkway), "Hachijo Higashi-guchi (Hachijo east entrance/exit)" for the southeast side on the ground, and "Nishinotoin-guchi (Nishinotoin entrance/exit" located on the second floor of Bic Camera JR Kyoto Shop, which is also accessible from the platform of San'in (Main) Line.

sen.j: 新幹線の出入口は、南側地上に「新幹線八条口」、南東側地上に「新幹線八条東口」、新幹線コンコース西側に「新幹線中央口」がある。
sen.e: There are two Shinkansen entrances, "Shinkansen Hachijo Entrance) and "Shinkansen Central Entrance" on the west side of the Shinkansen concourse.
There are two Shinkansen entrances--"Shinkansen Hachijo Entrance) and "Shinkansen Central Entrance"--on the west side of the Shinkansen concourse.

The Shinkansen entrances are located as follows: 'Shinkansen Hachijo-guchi (Shinkansen Hachijo Entrance)' on the south side at ground level, 'Shinkansen Hachijo Higashi-guchi (Shinkansen Hachijo East Entrance)' on the southeast side at ground level, and 'Shinkansen Chuo-guchi (Shinkansen Central Entrance)' on the west side of the Shinkansen concourse.

sen.j: 在来線と新幹線は「新幹線中央乗換口」と「新幹線東乗換口」を介して乗り換えできる。
sen.e: Conventional Lines and Shinkansen can be mutually transferred through "Shinkansen Central Transfer Gate" and "Shinkansen West Transfer Gate.
sen.cmt: 乗換口→定訳不明 transfer gateとしました。
sen.e: Conventional Lines and Shinkansen can be mutually transferred through the Shinkansen Central Transfer Gate and the Shinkansen West Transfer Gate.
Conventional lines and the Shinkansen can be mutually transferred through the Shinkansen Central Transfer Gate and the Shinkansen East Transfer Gate.

sen.j: 乗り換えは、烏丸口のバス利用者は「烏丸中央口」、八条口のバス利用者は「八条東口」「新幹線八条口」など、在来線⇔近鉄線は西口、在来線⇔地下鉄は地下東口、新幹線⇔近鉄線は新幹線中央口、新幹線⇔地下鉄は新幹線八条東口が便利。
sen.e: To transfer, for the passengers proceed from Karasuma-guchi bas stop, "Karasuma Chuo-guchi (Karasuma central entrance)", for those from Hachijo-guchi bas stop, "Hachijo Higashi-guchi (Hachijo east entrance)" or "Shinkansen Hachijo-guchi (Shinkansen Hachijo entrance)" is convenient, and to transfer from a conventional line to the Kintetsu Railway Line, or vice versa, "Nishi-guchi (west entrance/exit)", from a conventional line to the subway line, or vice versa, "Chika Higashi-guchi (underground east entrance/exit)", from Shinkansen to Kintetsu Railway Line, or vice versa "Shinkansen Hachijo Higashi-guchi (Shinkansen Hachijo east entrance/exit" is convenient, respectively.

To transfer, for the passengers proceeding from the Karasuma-guchi bus stop, "Karasuma Chuo-guchi (Karasuma central entrance)"; while for those from Hachijo-guchi bus stop, "Hachijo Higashi-guchi (Hachijo east entrance)" or "Shinkansen Hachijo-guchi (Shinkansen Hachijo entrance)" is convenient; to transfer from a conventional line to the Kintetsu Railway Line, or vice versa, "Nishi-guchi (west entrance/exit)"; from a conventional line to the subway line, or vice versa, "Chika Higashi-guchi (underground east entrance/exit)"; from Shinkansen to Kintetsu Railway Line, or vice versa, "Shinkansen Hachijo Higashi-guchi (Shinkansen Hachijo east entrance/exit" is convenient, respectively.

sen.cmt: 「烏丸口のバス乗り場へ進む」というふうに解釈し、proceed to にしました。新幹線中央口の訳抜けを追加しました。 各出口の括弧内の英訳を削除しました（既出のため）。括弧修正

sen.j: 他の京都市内にある各線の駅や大都市の主要駅と比べると、烏丸中央口は駅前のターミナル（バス・タクシー）が広くゆとりがあるのが特徴である。
sen.e: Comparing with other stations on different lines in Kyoto City and the terminal stations in other big cities, "Karasuma Chuo-guchi (Karasuma central entrance)" is distinguished by its spacious terminal for buses and taxies.

Compared with other stations on different lines in Kyoto City and the terminal stations in other large cities, "Karasuma Chuo-guchi (Karasuma central entrance)" is distinguished by its spacious terminal for buses and cabs.

sen.j: 現在の駅舎は4代目に当たる。
sen.e: The actual station building is the 4th generation.
The actual station building is now the fourth generation.
The actual station building is now the fourth generation.

sen.j: 1915年、大正天皇の即位の礼に併せて古典様式の2代目駅舎が渡辺節の設計により建築されたが、1950年失火により焼失、その後1952年に鉄筋コンクリート造の近代的な3代目駅舎が竣工した。
sen.e: In 1915, in conjunction with the enthronement ceremony of Emperor Taisho, the classical-style second generation station building was constructed after Setsu WATANABE's design, but it was burned down by an accidental fire in 1950, and after that, the third generation station building with ferroconcrete structure was completed in 1952.
sen.cmt: 大正天皇の即位の礼→the enthronement ceremony of Emperor Taisho（小学館プログレッシブ、英辞郎WEB参照）
sen.e: In 1915, in conjunction with the enthronement ceremony of Emperor Taisho, the classical-style second-generation station building was constructed after Setsu Watanabe's design, but it was burned down by an accidental fire in 1950; subsequently, the third-generation station building with a ferroconcrete structure was completed in 1952.

In 1915, in conjunction with Emperor Taisho's enthronement ceremony, the classical-style second-generation station building was constructed after Setsu WATANABE's design, but it was burned down by an accidental fire in 1950; subsequently, the third-generation station building with a ferroconcrete structure was completed in 1952.

sen.j: しかし、駅が発展すると共に増築に次ぐ増築を重ねたため、地下街を含む商店街や連絡通路などを含めると構内の構造は混迷を極め、大変不便なものになっていた。
sen.e: However, with the development of the station, the building underwent further extension repeatedly, and as a consequence, the station structure with a shopping area, including an underground shopping mall, and access-ways became extremely chaotic and terribly inconvenient.

However, with the development of the station the building underwent further extensions repeatedly, and as a consequence the station structure--with its shopping area, including an underground shopping mall and access-ways--became extremely chaotic and terribly inconvenient.

However, with the development of the station the building underwent further extensions repeatedly, and as a consequence the station structure--with its shopping area, including an underground shopping mall and access-ways--became extremely chaotic and terribly inconvenient.

sen.j: また駅舎本体にも老朽化に伴う種々の問題が生じて来た。
sen.e: In addition, the station structure itself had caused various problems as it was getting older.
Additionally, the station structure had caused various problems due to its age.
Additionally, the station structure had caused various problems due to its age.

sen.j: そこで、抜本的対策として駅ビルの改築が計画された。
sen.e: Therefore, the renovation of the building was planned as a drastic measure.
Therefore, the renovation of the building was planned as a drastic measure.
Therefore, the renovation of the building was planned as a drastic measure.

sen.j: これは1994年の平安京記念事業の一環でもあった。
sen.e: This was a part of the project implemented in 1994 to commemorate the anniversary of Heian-Kyo (the ancient capital).
sen.cmt: 平安京記念事業→定訳不明：project to commemorate the anniversary of Heian-Kyo (the ancient capital)としました。
sen.e: This was part of the project implemented in 1994 to commemorate the anniversary of Heian-Kyo (the ancient capital).
This was part of the project implemented in 1994 to commemorate the anniversary of Heian-Kyo (the ancient capital).

sen.j: なお、ホーム南側にも駅舎があるが、これは新幹線開通時に建設されたもので近鉄・新幹線のホーム下にあり、規模は小さく、新駅ビル建設の際も南北自由通路の設置やJR線と近鉄線の改札を完全分離化した事以外は大きな変更はなかった。
sen.e: South of the platforms, there is another station building beneath the platforms of the Kintetsu Railway Line and the Shinkansen, which was constructed when the Shinkansen began the operation, but underwent a little change during the renovation as being small in size, except for the construction of the Namboku Jiyu Tsuro (north-south free walkway) and the complete separation of the ticket wicket of the JR Line from that of the Kintetsu Railways Line.
sen.cmt: 南北自由通路→定訳不明：Namboku Jiyu Tsuro (north-south free walkway) としました。
sen.e: South of the platforms there is another station building beneath the platforms of the Kintetsu Railway Line and the Shinkansen, which was constructed when the Shinkansen went into operation, but it underwent a slight change during the renovation due to its small size except for the construction of the Namboku Jiyu Tsuro (north-south free walkway) and the complete separation of the ticket wicket of the JR Line from that of the Kintetsu Railway Line.

South of the platforms there is another station building beneath the platforms of the Kintetsu Line and the Shinkansen, which was constructed when the Shinkansen went into operation; however, it underwent a slight change during the renovation due to its small size except for the construction of the Nanboku-Jiyu-Tsuro and the complete separation of the ticket wicket of the JR Line from that of the Kintetsu Line.
sen.cmt: 文頭にon the を追加。南北自由通路の表記変更。

sen.j: この新しい駅舎になり、新しい京都市の顔となりつつある。
sen.e: With this newly-constructed building, the Station is becoming a new landmark of Kyoto City.
With this newly constructed building, the station is becoming a new landmark of Kyoto City.
With this newly constructed building, the station is becoming a new landmark of Kyoto City.

sen.j: また、嵯峨野線ホーム亀岡寄り側付近に『京都駅NKビル』が完成し、新しく改札口を設け、京都寄り車両に乗客が集中する嵯峨野線の混雑緩和を図っている。
sen.e: Near the edge of the platform of the Sagano Line to the direction of Kameoka Station, JR Kyoto Station NK Building was completed, and a new ticket wicket was installed there to alleviate the congestion of the Sagano Line caused by the passengers rushing to the cars stationed at the another end of the platform to the direction of Kyoto Station.
sen.cmt: J『京都駅NKビル』→定訳不明：JR Kyoto Station NK Building
sen.e: Near the edge of the platform of the Sagano Line to the direction of Kameoka Station, the JR Kyoto Station NK Building was completed and a new ticket wicket was installed there to alleviate the congestion of the Sagano Line, caused by the passengers rushing to the cars stationed at the another end of the platform to the direction of Kyoto Station.

Near the edge of the platform of the Sagano Line to the direction of Kameoka Station, the JR Kyoto Station NK building was completed and a new ticket wicket was installed there to alleviate the congestion of the Sagano Line caused by passengers rushing to the cars stationed at another end of the platform toward the direction of Kyoto Station.

sen.j: また、同ビルには家電量販店ビックカメラ京都店が出店された（西洞院口）。
sen.e: In this building, Bic Camera, an electronics retail store, opened its Kyoto shop ("Nishinotoin-guchi ").

tit.e: Construction and design of the station building
Construction and design of the station building
Construction and design of the station building

sen.j: 京都駅ビル（JR西日本）は、日本の鉄道駅舎としては異例の建築設計競技方式で行われ、新駅ビル設計者には原広司、安藤忠雄、池原義郎、黒川紀章、ジェームズ・スターリング (建築家)、バーナード・チュミ、ペーター・ブスマンの7名の複数の建築家が指名された。
sen.e: JR Kyoto Station Building (JR West) underwent an architectural design competition, unusual method for a Japanese railway stations, and 7 architects, Kouji HARA, Tadao ANDO, Yoshiro IKEHARA, Kisho KUROKAWA, James STIRLING, Bernard TSCHUMI, and Peter BUSSMANN, were appointed to compete.
sen.cmt: 建築家名前は用語リスト参照（以下の部分も同様）。
sen.e: JR Kyoto Station Building (JR West) underwent an architectural design competition (an unusual method for a Japanese railway station) and seven architects--Kouji Hara, Tadao Ando, Yoshiro Ikehara, Kisho Kurokawa, James Stirling, Bernard Tschumi and Peter Bussmann--were appointed to compete.

The JR Kyoto Station Building (JR West) underwent an architectural design competition (an unusual method for a Japanese railway station) and seven architects--Hiroshi HARA, Tadao ANDO, Yoshiro IKEHARA, Kisho KUROKAWA, James STIRLING, Bernard TSCHUMI and Peter BUSSMANN--were appointed to compete.

sen.j: 設計審査の結果、先ず原広司案、安藤案、スターリング案の3案に絞り込まれ、更なる協議を経て、原広司案が最終案として採用された。
sen.e: The eliminatory screening of the design narrowed the 7 proposals down to those of HARA, ANDO, and STIRLING, and after the further deliberation, the proposal of Koji HARA was adopted as the final plan.

The eliminatory screening of the design narrowed the seven proposals down to those of Hara, Ando and Stirling, and after the further deliberation the proposal of Koji Hara was adopted as the final plan.

The eliminatory screening of the design narrowed the seven proposals down to those of HARA, ANDO and STIRLING, and after further deliberation the proposal of Hiroshi HARA was adopted as the final plan.

sen.j: 京都駅周辺は高さ120mまでの建築物が建築可能となる特例措置が設けられているが、高さ制限の緩和は古都の景観を損なうものとして反対意見も根強かったため、建物の巨大さ、高さに起因する圧迫感を回避し、いかに周辺環境との調和を図るかが作品の評価のポイントとなった。
sen.e: Although the Kyoto Station area enjoys a preferential measure that permits the construction up to 120m high, the designs were evaluated from the point of how to achieve a harmony with the surrounding environment, avoiding the oppressive feeling caused by the huge size and height of the building, because there were persistent objections arguing that a loosened restriction in height might destroy the landscape of the ancient capital.

Although the Kyoto Station area enjoys a preferential measure that permits the construction to a height of 120m, the designs were evaluated from the stanbdpoint of how to achieve a harmony with the surrounding environment, avoiding the oppressive feeling caused by the huge size and height of the building, because there were persistent objections arguing that a loosened restriction in height might destroy the landscape of the ancient capital.

Although the Kyoto Station area enjoys a preferential measure that permits construction to a height of 120 m, the designs were evaluated from the standpoint of how to achieve harmony with the surrounding environment, avoiding the oppressive feeling caused by the huge size and height of the building, because there were persistent objections arguing that an easement of the height restriction might destroy the landscape of the ancient capital.

sen.j: 採用された設計案では、最大高さを60mに抑えた上で、南北方向の道路に合わせて建物を分割して視線を通すなど、圧迫感を回避するような配慮が随所に見られるが、根本的な解決になっているとは言い難い部分もある。
sen.e: The adopted design shows a various precautions to avoided the oppressive feeling, including the measure to securing a visual axis by dividing the building and limiting the maximum height to be less than 60m, but the design does not offer a perfect solution.

The adopted design shows various precautions to avoid any oppressive feeling, including the measure to secure a visual axis by dividing the building and limiting the maximum height to less than 60m, but the design does not offer a perfect solution.

The adopted design shows various precautions to avoid any oppressive feeling, including the measure to secure a visual axis by dividing the building in accordance with roads stretching to the north and south, and by limiting the maximum height to less than 60 m, but the design does not offer a perfect solution.
sen.cmt: 「南北の道路に合わせて」を追加しました。

sen.j: また、ハーフミラーのガラスやアルミパネルを多用した造形が古都に相応しくないとして、建設から10年近く経った今日でも否定的な意見も少なくない。
sen.e: In addition, even nowadays after nearly 10 years later since the construction, there are still many negative opinions criticizing that the form with heavy usage of half-mirror crystals and aluminum panels does not match with the ancient capital.

Additionally, even today, nearly ten years after the construction, there are still many negative opinions stating that the form, with its heavy use of half-mirror crystals and aluminum panels, doesn't match the ancient capital.

Additionally, even today, nearly ten years after the construction, there are still many negative opinions stating that the form, with its heavy use of half-mirror crystals and aluminum panels, doesn't match the ancient capital.

sen.j: 完成した駅ビルは、東西の両側にホテルと伊勢丹が位置し、その間の中央部は、改札口の上にある細長いホテル客室棟をガラスの正面と大屋根で覆う広々とした吹き抜けになっている。
sen.e: The completed station building has a hotel in the east side and a department store Isetan in the west side, respectively, and the center is the spacious wellhole-style hall with a huge vaulted glass ceiling and a glass facade covering the slender guestroom ward of the hotel constructed above the ticket gates.
sen.cmt: 吹き抜け→wellwhole-style (小学館プログレッシブ和英）
sen.e: The completed station building has a hotel on the east side and an Isetan department store on the west side; the center is a spacious wellhole-style hall with a huge, vaulted glass ceiling and a glass facade covering the slender guestroom wing of the hotel constructed above the ticket gates.

The completed station building has a hotel on the east side and an Isetan department store on the west side; the center is a spacious wellhole-style hall with a huge, vaulted glass ceiling and a glass facade covering the slender guestroom wing of the hotel constructed above the ticket gates.

sen.j: 吹き抜けから東西へは渓谷状の階段が設けられている。
sen.e: The wellhole-style hall outstretches two "valley" staircases to east and to west.
sen.cmt: 渓谷状の階段→定訳不明 渓谷橋タイプ側壁のない階段のことと思われます。"Valley" staircaseとしました。（http:www.oyster-web.co.uk、www.panoramio.com参照）

sen.j: 伊勢丹側の大階段は10階分の高低差があり、非常時の避難経路とする事を想定した。
sen.e: The grand staircase set on the Isetan side measures 10-story high, which was installed assuming that this would serve as an escape route in an emergency.

sen.j: 3層構造で、1階は改札口（八条口）・駅事務室・名店街、2階がホームと改札口（中央口、この改札口は開業当初から長らく旧国鉄→現JR京都駅の内部にある形で乗換用の改札機もあったが、現京都駅ビル建設および同駅南北自由通路設置に合わせて両社の改札口は完全分離化された）、3階はJR東海の新幹線ホームとなっている。
sen.e: It has a three-layered structure: on the 1st floor, a ticket wicket (Hachijo-guchi entrance), the station office, and Meitengai shopping arcade are placed, on the 2nd floor, the platforms and a ticket wicket (Chuo-guchi entrance) are placed (a ticket gate was located inside the JNR/JR Station for a long time with a wicket machine for transfer, but when the new station building was constructed and the Nanboku Jiyu Tsuro (north-south free walkway) was made, the ticket wickets of the two companies were completely separated), on the 3rd floor, the platforms for the JR Central Shinkansen..

sen.e: At first, it was the final station of the railroad between Kobe and Kyoto, and was the second railway inaugurated after the railroad opened between Shinbashi and Yokohama.

sen.j: このため、路線形状の都合から当時の繁華街である四条河原町地域からは遠く離れた京都市でも南の地域、即ち七条通 - 八条通付近に京都駅は設置されたが、それ以外にも用地買収の楽な寂れた地域（四条通に沿って建設する事は用地買収面以外にも、祇園地区において八坂神社などの境内に当たる事や周辺の伝統的な家屋の立ち退きを伴う事などから、市民感情から考えても猛反発を受けた可能性が高かったと見られる）だったというのが、この土地を選択した要因になったといわれている。
sen.e: Therefore, it is said that owing to this favorable route setup, Kyoto Station was constructed in the southern area of Kyoto City, around Shichijo-dori Street and Hachijo-dori Street, although this area was far from the Shijo Kawaramachi area, the then prominent center, but another reason for the selection can be supposed: at that time the area was underdeveloped and it was easy to acquire the site (if it had had been constructed along the Shijo-dori Street, in addition to the difficulties in purchasing the land, the acquisition would have met a strong emotional objection of the citizens because railroading should have been carried out in the Gion District that have many temples and shrines such as Yasaka-jinja Shrine and the traditional houses in the vicinity should have been removed).

Therefore, it is said that owing to this favorable route setup, Kyoto Station was constructed in the southern area of Kyoto City, around Shichijo-dori Street and Hachijo-dori Street, although this area was far from the Shijo Kawaramachi area, a prominent center of the time. However, another reason for the selection can be supposed: at that time the area was underdeveloped and it was easy to acquire the site (if it had had been constructed along the Shijo-dori Street, but in addition to the difficulties in purchasing the land, the acquisition would have met a strong emotional objection of the citizens because railroading should have been carried out in the Gion District that has many temples and shrines such as Yasaka-jinja Shrine, and the traditional houses in the vicinity should have been removed).

Thus it is said that, owing to this favorable route setup, Kyoto Station was constructed in the southern area of Kyoto City, around Shichijo-dori Street and Hachijo-dori Street, although this area was far from the Shijo-Kawaramachi area, a prominent center of the time. However, another reason for the selection could be that the area was underdeveloped at the time and it was easy to acquire the site (if it had been constructed along the Shijo-dori Street, the acquisition of the land would have met strong emotional opposition from the citizens in addition to the difficulties in purchasing it, because railroading should have been carried out in the Gion District, which has many temples and shrines such as Yasaka-jinja Shrine, and the traditional houses in the vicinity should have been removed).
sen.cmt: Shijo-Kawaramachi ハイフネーション, 語順を入れ替え、had のだぶりを削除しました。

sen.j: 後に京都から大津までの鉄道も開業するが、この時のルートは東山 (京都府)にトンネルを開削するだけの技術がまだなかった事から、現在のJR奈良線を稲荷駅周辺まで南下した後、現在の名神高速道路が走っている敷地を通って、大津へと向かうものとなった（大津駅の項目も参照）。
sen.e: Later, a railway opened from Kyoto to Otsu, but at that time the rout proceeded toward Otsu, through the site where the Meishin Highway is actually running, after going far down to the south nera the present Inari Station on the Nara Line, because the drilling technology to cut a tunnel through the Higashi-yama Mountain (Kyoto Prefecture) was not available.

Later, a railway opened from Kyoto to Otsu, but at that time the route proceeded toward Otsu, through the site where the Meishin Highway actually runs, after going far down to the south near the present Inari Station on the Nara Line, because the drilling technology to cut a tunnel through Mt. Higashi-yama (Kyoto Prefecture) was not available.

Later, a railway opened from Kyoto to Otsu, but at that time the route proceeded toward Otsu, through the site where the Meishin Expressway in fact runs, after going far down to the south near the present Inari Station on the Nara Line, because the drilling technology needed to cut a tunnel through Higashiyama (Kyoto Prefecture) wasn't available.
sen.cmt: 名神高速の訳を修正しました。"actually" -> "in fact" に変更しました。

sen.j: その後山陰本線が開通し、後に近鉄京都線となる奈良電気鉄道や市内の路面電車（京都市電）の発着点にもなって、京都駅周辺は急速に発展していった。
sen.e: Afterwards, with the opening of the San'in Main Line, the station became the departure and arrival point of the Nara Electric Railway and the city trams (Kyoto City Trams), and the areas around the station had rapidly developed.

Subsequently, with the opening of the San'in Main Line the station became the departure and arrival point of the Nara Electric Railway and the city trams (Kyoto City Trams), so the area around the station developed rapidly.

Subsequently, with the opening of the Sanin Main Line the station became the departure and arrival point of the Nara Electric Railway and the city trams (Kyoto City Trams), so the area around the station developed rapidly.

sen.j: なお、1921年（大正10年）8月1日に東海道本線のルートが逢坂山トンネル・東山トンネルの開通によって馬場～京都間で変更・短縮される事になった際に、至便性を上げるため五条通の市街地近くに駅を移設する案と、新しい市街地の開発を図るため京都北部を周回するルートに変えて、二条駅が現在設けられている付近に新しい京都総合駅を設けようという案もあったが、市街地付近に線路を引き込むのは予算や用地・工事の面で困難であった事と、京都付近で線路を周回させるのはトンネル開通に伴う距離短縮効果を失わせるという事から、どちらも立ち消えになった。
sen.e: Besides, on August 1, 1921, when the route of the Tokaido Main Line was to be changed and shortened thanks to the opening of Osakayama Tunnel and Higashiyama Tunnel, two plans － one was transferring the station toward the urban area around the Gojo-dori Street to enhance the convenience, and the other was changing the existing route to a circuitous route and constructing a new Kyoto general station near the present Nijo Station in order to promote the development of a new urban area －were proposed to improve the utility, although later on both of the two plans had faded away, owing to the difficulty of extending the line close to the urban area as well as the inconvenience that if the line were to go around Kyoto, the distance shortened by the opening of the tunnels would be offset.

Moreover, on August 1, 1921, when the route of the Tokaido Main Line was to be changed and shortened thanks to the opening of Osakayama Tunnel and Higashiyama Tunnel, two plans--one being to transfer the station toward the urban area around the Gojo-dori Street to enhance the convenience, and the other being to change the existing route to a circuitous route and construct a new Kyoto general station near the present Nijo Station in order to promote the development of a new urban area--were proposed to improve the utility, although eventually both plans faded, owing to the difficulty of extending the line close to the urban area as well as the inconvenience that if the line were to go around Kyoto the distance shortened by the opening of the tunnels would be offset.

Moreover, on August 1, 1921, when the route of the Tokaido Main Line in the section between Baba and Kyoto was to be changed and shortened thanks to the opening of Osakayama Tunnel and Higashiyama Tunnel, two plans--one being to transfer the station toward the urban area around the Gojo-dori Street in order to enhance the convenience, and the other being to change the existing route to a circuitous route in the northern part of Kyoto and construct a new Kyoto general station near the present Nijo Station so as to promote the development of a new urban area--were proposed to improve the utility, although eventually both plans faded, owing to the difficulty of budgeting and construction extending the line close to the urban area as well as the inconvenience that if the line were to go around Kyoto the distance shortened by the opening of the tunnels would be offset.

sen.j: 東海道新幹線の計画当初は、京都駅を経由せずに京都府南部を短絡させて同地に新幹線の駅を設け、速達列車の「ひかり (列車)」は京都を通過させる案となっていた。
sen.e: The fact is that the original plan of the Shinkansen, in which the rapid Shinkansen "Hikari" was planned to go without stopping at Kyoto station, bypassing the southern Kyoto Prefecture with a new station, met considerable opposition from the local governments and residents, which had been calmed down with the plan of creating the platform for Shinkansen within the Kyoto Station (Please see the section "Railways and Politics).

The fact is that the original plan of the Shinkansen, in which the rapid Shinkansen "Hikari" was planned to run without stopping at Kyoto station and thus bypass the southern Kyoto Prefecture with a new station, met considerable opposition from the local governments and residents, which had been calmed down with the plan of creating the platform for Shinkansen within the Kyoto Station (Please see the section "Railways and Politics").
The original plan for the 'Hikari' Shinkansen was for it to run without stopping at Kyoto Station, thus bypassing the southern part of Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 自治体や地元市民などの猛反発を受けた事から、京都駅に新幹線ホームを併設の上で全列車停車に落ち着いた経緯がある（鉄道と政治の項目も参照の事）。
sen.e: This was met by considerable opposition from the local governments and residents, however, who had been appeased with a plan to create a platform for the Shinkansen within Kyoto Station (see the Railways and Politics section for further details).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: また「のぞみ (列車)」が登場した1992年3月、東京発の一番列車「のぞみ301号」は名古屋駅と京都駅を通過していた。
sen.e: When "Nozomi" was introduced in March, 1992, at the outset, "Nozomi 301", the first train starting from Tokyo was running without stopping at Nagoya and Kyoto.

sen.j: 名古屋では名古屋飛ばしとして問題となったが、京都では観光に適した時間帯の列車でもなかった事から、ほとんど問題視されなかった。
sen.e: In Nagoya the people protested saying "Nagoya has been skipped, skipped", while in Kyoto, the people were little nervous about it because it was not the train that arrived at the best time for tourism.

sen.e: The present Omiya Station (Kyoto Prefecture) on the Hankyu Kyoto Mail Line was called "Hankyu Kyoto Station", until the line was extended to Kawaramachi Station (Kyoto Prefecture) in 1963 ("Keihanshin Kyoto Station", until 1949 when the Keihan Electric Railway was decoupled, and "Keihan Kyoto Station" when the station was opened).
